|brand = Corega |model = CG-WLAP11 |submodelappend = <!-- yes, for space --> |submodel = <!-- SubModel number, Leave blank for unknown --> |revision = (APL-11) |subrevision = <!-- Model Subrevision, Leave blank for none or unknown --> |model_part_num = |page_start_date = |page_start_origon = |wlclass = B11 |series = <!-- Device series --> |type = access point |sernum = <!-- First 4 or so for easy version identification --> |fcc_id = <!-- Federal Communication Commission Identification Number --> |icid = <!-- Industry Canada Identification number, Leave blank for unknown --> |us_id = <!-- US ID number --> |boardid = <!-- Board Identification, Leave blank for none --> |ecc_id = <!-- eec-id -->
|cpu1chip1 = Ubicom;IP2022; |cpu1_cores = 1 |cpu1_type = Ubicom 32 |cpu1_type_rev = <!-- CPU1 type Revision, Leave blank for unknown --> |cpu1spd = <!-- 120/160MHz --> |is_doc = |bus = <!-- 8-bit, 16-bit, 32-bit, 64-bit, Leave blank for none -->
|flash1type = <!-- Parallel,Serial(SPI),NAND,Compact Flash --> |fla1_num = <!-- 1,2,3,4 --> |fla1chip = SST;; |flash1size = <!-- Size of flash --> |flash1maxsize = <!-- Maximum size firmware can be in bytes -->
|ram1type = <!-- DDR,DDR2,DDR3,DDR4 --> |ram1type1 = <!-- SO-DIMM,SDRAM --> |ram1spd = <!-- RAM speed --> |ram1size = <!-- Size of RAM --> |ram1chip = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |ram1_num = <!-- Number of Ram chips --> |nvramsize = <!-- 32, 60, 64, etc... in kb, Leave blank for unknown -->
|eth_cpu = true |lan_ports = 1 |lan_speed = 10MbE |ethstandard = <!-- auto --> |auto_mdix = <!-- mdix support --> |sup_jumbo = <!-- Jumbo frames support --> |ethoui = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |oui = <!-- Wireless OUI -->
|bootwait = <!-- On or Off, Leave blank for unknown --> |stockbootloader = <!-- Name;Version;Distro --> |stockos = <!-- Name;Version;Distro -->
|exp_if_types = <!-- Expansion Interface types, Leave blank for none -->
|pwr_volt_type = VDC |pwr_vdc = 5 |pwr_amp_dc = 1.5 |pwr_conn = barrel |pwr_barrel_outer = <!-- Outer barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_inner = <!-- Inner barrel size in mm --> |pwr_barrel_len = <!-- Length of barrel --> |pwr_pol = <!-- Connector polarity -->
|serial = <!-- Full Serial info --> |jtag = <!-- Full JTAG info -->
|specialfeat = <!-- Features that don't fit any place else, Leave blank for none --> |flags = <!-- flags, Leave blank for none --> |addchip = <!-- Additional Chips --> |802dot11_protocols = b
|defaulip = 192.168.1.230 |defaultlogin = <!-- default Login Name, Leave blank for unknown --> |defaultpass = <!-- default Password, Leave blank for unknown --> |defaultssid = corega |defaultssid_regex = ^corega$ |default_ch = <!-- Defaults channel(s) Radio(s) are set to --> |manuf = BroMax |manuf_model = <!-- Manufacturer Model --> |manuf_rev = <!-- Manufacturer Revision --> |is_manuf = No |tpfirmware = <!-- Third party firmware official support, AsusWRT-Merlin, CeroWrt, DD-WRT, DD-WRT (kong), DD-WRT (kongac), DD-WRT (kongarm), FreedomBox, FreshTomato-ARM, Gargoyle, LibreWrt, Oleg (wl500g), Oleg-ng (wl500g), OpenWrt, Tomato, Tomato RAF, Tomato (shibby), Tomato (Toastman), TomatoUSB, Wive-NG -->
|availability = in Japan, in Europe |fccapprovdate = <!-- FCCID approval date --> |estreldate = 04/2002 |estprice = <!-- Estimated retail price in US dollars --> |upc = <!-- UPC number --> |ean = 4519157000147 |newegg = <!-- newegg item number --> |asin = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country = <!-- ASIN country --> |asin2 = <!-- ASIN number --> |asin_country2 = <!-- ASIN country --> |countrymanuf = Taiwan
|buttons = <!-- buttons available --> |led = <!-- Led colors and descriptions --> |dimensions = <!-- Size of device {{convert |length|x|widthordepth|x|height|in|mm}} --> |weight = <!-- Weight of device {{convert|weight|oz|g}} -->
|wi1_if_name = |rad1mod = BroMax WM253-IJ |rad1modif = PCMCIA (16-bit) (non-standard connector) |wi1_if_name = |rad1chip1 = Intersil;; |rad1chip2 = Intersil;ISL3685; |rad1chip3 = <!-- Brand;Model;Extra, info; --> |rad1oui = <!-- Only if different from above OUI --> |rad1_ant_conn = <!-- Leave blank for unknown --> |rad1stand = IEEE 802.11b |rad1b = 11 |rad1freq = 2.4
}}{{TIDTOC|embedded}} ==Overview== [http://www.geocities.co.jp/SiliconValley-Bay/4096/tmp245.html Internal images are available on this '''GeoCities''' page of a JP user that modified their unit (and '''I-O DATA''' NP-BBRP router) to support PoE] :"3752-03100010" is silkscreened on the main board. A date code of '''0217''' (April 2002) is etched onto the bottom of the board. ::There is a '''SST''' Flash on-board :"WM253-IJ", "SN", "REV"<...>, and a date code of '''0213''' (April 2002) is silkscreened on the PRISM 2.5 wireless module.
This device does not appear to have a HTTP configuration interface.
Default settings (including the SSID) are per '''corega''''s manual. :There is no default password. Additional specifications, per the manual and product page, follow... *Antenna: dipole, single *Range **Maximum: 50 meters (indoors), 150 meters (outdoors) **@11Mbps: 1Mbps: 30 meters (indoors), 60 meters (outdoors) *Dimensions (H x D x W): [[Dimensions::110 mm x 73 mm x 22 mm]] *Weight (unit itself, no AC adapter): [[Weight::156 g]] *Power supply: external (coaxial connector), 5VDC 1.5A input *Power consumption: 1.9 W (maximium) *Current consumption: 350 mA (average), 370 mA (maximum)
{{WiFiCert|W000568|09/04/2002}}
==Links of Interest== *[http://corega.jp/support/manual/pdf/wlapl11_a.pdf Manual]
